p: Tackling future biological security challenges within the UK will require evidence-based policy, coupled with rational precaution. One of the key themes of the UK Biological Security Strategy is ‘a strong science base’, and it highlights that all actions in biosecurity must be “underpinned by high quality science and evidence if it is to be effective” [ 5]. This need for evidence-based policy has been acknowledged [ 8]. Despite this, many biological security topics are neglected and there is a risk that policy-makers will not use evidence to inform decisions, due to lack of awareness or “evidence complacency” [ 9]. Furthermore, researchers may fail to effectively communicate the nuances of policy-relevant topics.
